name: htmldiff
readme:
# htmldiff.js ### HTML Diffing in JavaScript (ok, CoffeeScript actually.) [![Build Status](https://secure.travis-ci.org/tnwinc/htmldiff.js.png)](http://travis-ci.org/tnwinc/htmldiff.js) `htmldiff.js` is a CoffeeScript port of https://github.com/myobie/htmldiff (This one has a few more tests.) This is diffing that understands HTML. Best suited for cases when you want to show a diff of user-generated HTML (like from a wysiwyg editor). ##Usage You use it like this: ```coffeescript diff = require 'htmldiff.js' console.log diff '

this is some text

', '

this is some more text

' ``` And you get: ```html

this is some more text

``` ##Module It should be multi-module aware. ie. it should work as a node.js module or an AMD (RequireJS) module, or even just as a script tag. Licensed under the MIT License. See the `LICENSE` file for details.
